page.title: 17Arts and crafts, Faceby
page.content: Although no evening classes in crafts are held in Faceby, there are several ladies with various skills. One takes classes in neighbouring villages, specialising in{soft furnishing}and all types of{embroidery}including ecclesiastical. Another, a farmer's wife, has made{corn dollies}for many years, produces exquisite{lace}which wins her many prizes at local shows, and does{counted-thread work, canvas {and patchwork.}She has a spinning wheel and, when time allows,{spins and {weaves wool}from her own sheep. Another Faceby lady makes{scraperboard pictures. From time to time a handicraft exhibition is held in the village. In the Swainby part of the block a retired ICI engineer{paints} landscapes and abstracts, using acrylics because of allergy to some substance in water-colour paints.
